  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public Object getInstance()
      Get the object instance
      Returns:
      the object instance

    • make

      public byte[] make()
      Make the message. No need to check whether mandatory fields are set, because the constructors of outgoing pdus are taking care of this.
      Returns:
      OutputStream of maked message. Return null if the PDU is invalid.

    • arraycopy

      public void arraycopy(byte[] buf, int pos, int length)
      Copy buf to mMessage.

    • append

      public void append(int value)
      Append a byte to mMessage.

    • appendShortInteger

      public void appendShortInteger(int value)
      Append short integer value to mMessage. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • appendOctet

      public void appendOctet(int number)
      Append an octet number between 128 and 255 into mMessage. NOTE: A value between 0 and 127 should be appended by using appendShortInteger. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • appendShortLength

      public void appendShortLength(int value)
      Append a short length into mMessage. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • appendLongInteger

      public void appendLongInteger(long longInt)
      Append long integer into mMessage. it's used for really long integers. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • appendTextString

      public void appendTextString(byte[] text)
      Append text string into mMessage. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • appendTextString

      public void appendTextString(String str)
      Append text string into mMessage. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • appendEncodedString

      public void appendEncodedString(Object enStr)
      Append encoded string value to mMessage. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.
      Parameters:
      enStr - (EncodedStringValue)

    • appendUintvarInteger

      public void appendUintvarInteger(long value)
      Append uintvar integer into mMessage. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • appendDateValue

      public void appendDateValue(long date)
      Append date value into mMessage. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • appendValueLength

      public void appendValueLength(long value)
      Append value length to mMessage. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • appendQuotedString

      public void appendQuotedString(byte[] text)
      Append quoted string to mMessage. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • appendQuotedString

      public void appendQuotedString(String str)
      Append quoted string to mMessage. This implementation doesn't check the validity of parameter, since it assumes that the values are validated in the GenericPdu setter methods.

    • checkAddressType

      public static final int checkAddressType(String address)
      Check address type.
      Parameters:
      address - address string without the postfix stinng type, such as "/TYPE=PLMN", "/TYPE=IPv6" and "/TYPE=IPv4"
      Returns:
      PDU_PHONE_NUMBER_ADDRESS_TYPE if it is phone number, PDU_EMAIL_ADDRESS_TYPE if it is email address, PDU_IPV4_ADDRESS_TYPE if it is ipv4 address, PDU_IPV6_ADDRESS_TYPE if it is ipv6 address, PDU_UNKNOWN_ADDRESS_TYPE if it is unknown.
